channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust's Annual Christmas Appeal
item.description:
Sunday, November 19, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support the Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust's Annual Christmas Appeal.

For more than 60 years, the Trust’s fundraising efforts have improved the wellbeing of the most marginalised, vulnerable members of the Brisbane community. Established in the 1960s, the Trust continues the good work of the Lord Mayor whose mission is to improve the liveability of all Brisbane residents. The Trust’s work supports charities that assist people suffering from disability, homelessness, mental illness, drug or alcohol addiction, trauma, abuse or neglect. The annual Christmas Appeal raises funds for our Christmas grant where charities apply for toys, Foodbank food vouchers or to host a client Christmas party.

This Light Up is organised by: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Transgender Day of Remembrance
item.description:
Monday, November 20, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue Pink and White to support Transgender Day of Remembrance.

Many Genders One Voice holds a Transgender Day of Remembrance ceremony every year, as part of other international events that occur during Transgender Awareness Week. This week aims to help raise the visibility of transgender, gender diverse and non-binary people, and address the issues the community faces. The final day of Transgender Awareness Week is Transgender Day of Remembrance (TDOR), an annual observance on November 20 that honours the memory of those whose lives were lost in acts of anti-transgender violence.

This Light Up is organised by: Many Genders One Voice and Queensland AIDS Council

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Greg Norman Medal Dinner
item.description:
Tuesday, November 21, 2023

City Hall will be lit Green to celebrate the Greg Norman Medal Dinner.

The Greg Norman Medal, Australian golf’s most prestigious award, will be awarded at a Gala Dinner held at City Hall.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Zonta Says No to Violence Against Women
item.description:
Tuesday, November 21, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Orange to support Zonta Says No to Violence Against Women.

The Zonta Club of Brisbane East Inc, a member of Zonta International, raises funds annually to support local projects towards a common goal – to improve the legal, educational, economic, political and health status of women. The Club is not for profit, run by volunteers and all funds raised are directed to projects, such as educational scholarships for women, support to women refuges and support services such as Brisbane Domestic Violence Service. Annually the Zonta Clubs of Brisbane conduct a campaign, under the Banner Zonta Says No to Violence against Women, to raise awareness of domestic and family violence in the community and to support women and their children when they find themselves in such a situation.

This Light Up is organised by: Zonta Club of Brisbane East Inc

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: National Asbestos Awareness Week
item.description:
Thursday, November 23, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support National Asbestos Awareness Week.

National Asbestos Awareness Week is held from Monday 20/11/23 to Sunday 26/11/23 to raise awareness about asbestos related diseases, to remember the many thousands of people who have died as a result of an asbestos related diseases and to encourage Australians to protect themselves against exposure to asbestos-containing materials, particularly when doing home renovations.

This Light Up is organised by: Asbestos Disease Support Society Limited

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

National Asbestos Awareness Week is held from Monday 20/11/23 to Sunday 26/11/23 to raise awareness about asbestos related diseases, to remember the many thousands of people who have died as a result of an asbestos related diseases and to encourage Australians to protect themselves against exposure to asbestos-containing materials, particularly when doing home renovations.

This Light Up is organised by: Asbestos Disease Support Society Limited

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: Australian PGA Championships - Jarrod Lyle Day
item.description:
Friday, November 24, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Yellow to support Australian PGA Championships - Jarrod Lyle Day.

On 24th November, the Australian PGA Championship will be helping to raise much-needed funds for Challenge, a charity devoted to supporting children and families living with cancer. Professionals and all involved in the tournament will be #DoingItForJarrod and wearing yellow in memory of Jarrod Lyle, an ambassador for Challenge and the ongoing dedication of this charity.  #DoingitforJarrod

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Australian PGA Championships
item.description:
Saturday, November 25, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue to celebrate the Australian PGA Championships.

The Australian PGA Championship is the PGA's flagship event. One of the feature events on the ISPS HANDA PGA Tour of Australasia, the time-honoured tournament will be played in Brisbane. Some of the world's best golfers are expected to converge on the event to complete for the Joe Kirkwood Cup - Australian professional golf's oldest trophy.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust's Annual Christmas Appeal
item.description:
Sunday, November 26, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support the Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust's Annual Christmas Appeal.

For more than 60 years, the Trust’s fundraising efforts have improved the wellbeing of the most marginalised, vulnerable members of the Brisbane community. Established in the 1960s, the Trust continues the good work of the Lord Mayor whose mission is to improve the liveability of all Brisbane residents. The Trust’s work supports charities that assist people suffering from disability, homelessness, mental illness, drug or alcohol addiction, trauma, abuse or neglect. The annual Christmas Appeal raises funds for our Christmas grant where charities apply for toys, Foodbank food vouchers or to host a client Christmas party.

This Light Up is organised by: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Founder's Day
item.description:
Wednesday, November 29, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Pink to support Founder's Day.

On Founder’s Day swara celebrates the lives and what would have been the 100th birthday of the wonderful Pink Twins and founders - Dorothy and Moyia O’Brien. The Pink twins were the first two female occupational therapists in Australia, with a passion for the colour pink which led to their affectionate nickname of ‘The Pink Twins’. Swara was founded by the Pink Twins in 1975 when they retired from occupational therapy, after they noticed the gap in the healthcare system for individuals with disabilities. This year would have also been the Pink Twin’s 100th birthday giving swara more reasons to celebrate the lives and legacy of the Pink Twins, and continue to empower the lives of those they help, so all can reach their full potential in a loving environment.

This Light Up is organised by: Swara Group

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
